newsitem.title: USA: Fed asks NationsBank for more merger data.
newsitem.headline: Fed asks NationsBank for more merger data.

text.p: The Federal Reserve Board Tuesday asked NationsBank Corp to provide copies of any post-1989 state examinations of its consumer finance unit NationsCredit to support its application to acquire Boatmen's Bancshares Inc.

The request was in a letter from the Fed's legal department to Gerald Hurst, associate general counsel of NationsBank. Inner City Press/Community on the Move, a group which has cited lending practices at NationsCredit in its opposition to the proposed merger, received a copy of the corresponence and distributed copies to news media.
A spokeswoman for NationsBank said she had not seen the Fed's request and would not be able to comment immediately.

Inner City Press has argued that NationsCredit has never received a community lending review from either the Federal Reserve or the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC). The group contends NationsBank through NationsCredit has engaged in price discrimination including charging people of color more for loans.
The proposed merger is valued at about $10 billion.
NationsBank rose 1-5/8 Tuesday to 95-1/8. Boatmen's rose one to 61-1/8.
